author: Susan C
title: I'm too old for this
text:
The lobby is super cool; the restaurants are equally as cool but the hallways to the rooms reminded me of a prison - seriously! Dark gray walls with bright green doors and the moment I stepped in, I got super claustrophobic. The room is tiny - not NYC tiny but tiny I'm 5'5 and when I sat on the toilet - my knees touched the wall - yikes.
Not for business either - trying to find plugs was a challenge. The insulation was not good so I got to hear sirens, horns and trash trucks all night long. If you're under 30 - go for it. Also - even though the room price is relatively low (as it should be), the cost of food/coffee/etc. is expensive - $5+ for a cup of plain coffee and don't be surprised by the $30+ "hotel fee" (essentially a resort fee) for a whole lot of nothing.
